intro: Koanophyllon hardwarense, commonly known as the hardy grassland daisy, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact, low-growing habit with narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers in shades of yellow and white, typically blooming during the cooler months. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures. Koanophyllon hardwarense is often used in xeriscaping due to its resilience and ornamental value.
